intro: Uncaria africana, commonly known as African climbing tea, is a woody vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for birds and small mammals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
